info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:12AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Berks, southeastern Lehigh, northwestern Montgomery and west central Bucks Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 112 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fleetwood, or 9 miles northeast of Reading, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Pottstown, Phoenixville, Quakertown, Perkasie, Souderton, Collegeville, Kutztown, Royersford, Fleetwood, Trappe, East Greenville, Topton, Schwenksville, Bally, Bechtelsville, Green Lane, Lyons, Zionsville and Spring Mount. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 32 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
